text: The Dore is a river in central France in the Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region, in the Puy-de-Dôme department. It is a right tributary of the Allier river and it is one of the three more important tributaries of the Allier river (with the Sioule and Alagnon rivers). ==Geography== The Dore river has a length of , and a drainage basin with an area of . Its valley is between the Monts du Forez, to the east, and the Monts du Livradois, to the west. ===Course=== The Dore starts in the place known as Bois de Berny, in the commune of Saint-Bonnet-le- Bourg, (Puy-de-Dôme department), at an altitude of about . From here, the Dore flows first to the southeast and then to the northwest. The Dore river flows within the Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region, the Puy-de-Dôme department and 21 communes. It flows through the following communes, among others: Dore-l’Église, Marsac-en-Livradois, Ambert, Vertolaye, Olliergues, Sauviat, Courpière, Néronde-sur-Dore, Peschadoires, Dorat, Puy-Guillaume. Finally, it flows into the Allier river in the commune of Ris. ==Main tributaries== The main tributaries of the Dore river are: Left tributaries: * Dolore - 28.1 km * Miodet - 30.4 Right tributaries: * Faye - 24.6 km * Couzon - 22.4 km * Durolle - 32.1 * Credogne - 27.8 == Hydrology == Its average yearly discharge (volume of water which passes through a section of the river per unit of time) is at Dorat in the Puy-de-Dôme department, for the period 1991 - 2017.
